And every single dish lacks character. All had a very basic taste and lacked bite and seasoning. A good example would be the wings they serve for lunch, these are simple non-breaded wings with a thin layer of some sort of weak hot sauce. They looked "okay" but tasted terrible. The best tasting thing available may be the Mongolia because it was cooked fresh and had a bit more flavor than the other dishes. Service was very nice, so that earns them another star than one.

The stand out here was the pork belly with the crispy skin. So delicious!  A little underseasoned but that's easy to fix. And I liked the Mongolian grill. But that's it. Food was meh and it's no top tier like the Bellagio. But I was full and satisfied. Service was friendly.

Not all Vegas buffets are created equally. Paying $35 for a below average buffet (cough, Luxor) can be a frustrating experience.

When I saw that the Bistro Buffet was only $19.99 for brunch ($12.99 with a free Palms player card), I had to give it a shot.

First observation- "This line is taking forever!" Granted, it was January 1st, but the medium-sized line moved at a glacial pace. We had to wait nearly 30-40 minutes to be seated.

Second observation- "This is a pretty average buffet." The old adage of "you get what you pay for" definitely rang true. Bistro Buffet has everything you would expect from a buffet: salad bar, soups, Asian food, Mexican food,Southern food, seafood, and mini-desserts. Nearly all of these options were average at best. But, hey, average tastes a lot better when it's super affordable.

Third observation- "This server is doing an awesome job." At most buffets, I'd be satisfied if the server stopped by more than once to check on us. Our server, Hicela (sp?), welcomed us right as we were seated. She had already brought water and mimosas. During our meal, she stopped by at least three times to make sure everything was alright. 

I would definitely consider returning to this buffet.

Stay away. Choices minimal.
Food tasteless price for Sunday brunch way too high for what is offered.Help is overtaxed dishes remain on table. Try to get a  second cup o coffee  not

Been here many time before. It was good enough to leave full without breaking the bank but recently I've noticed their options have dropped off. There are less seafood options as before. 

With the Maloof family no longer owning this place, change is noticeable and so are the patrons. This place used to have a mix of local elders and young people who didn't make it onto the strip. 

The food quality has always remained good and same with the service.  What was great was how easily they comped meals... If you had to pay to eat it's still worth it as there was t ever a line. He seating was spaced well enough where you didn't feel cramped or like you were part of another party. 

Their brunch was good and better than the Gold Coast but a bit pricier too. 

If you're hungry and have a few bucks to spend, this is the place for you.

The Feast buffet at Red Rock blows this place out of the water!  It's the same price for lunch $8.99 and one players card is good for two people. At this buffet each adult has to have their own card.

At first this place looked promising. Smelled really good outside the buffet, and had so many seafood dishes, meat galore, lots of dishes. Then after trying a few dishes, I found many of them were overcooked. There were tons of seafood dishes, but every dish was mussels and squid.

The Thai curries were good at first, but after a few bites, it was SO salty!

Carving station was hit or miss. The tri tip was actually very good according to bf. The turkey was cold. The pork belly was dry and the crispy skin was cold and hard.

The salad bar didn't have cottage cheese or beets (two of my favorites for my salad). And the fruit bowl was never replenished the whole time we were there. All the watermelon was gone, as was most the honey dew. But there was a whole bunch of cantelope left, which proves that it's gross. The wild rice salad was totally undercooked. So hard I had to spit it out. The steamed veggies in the American section was so bland. Just plain steamed frozen looking veggies. Those are the type of veggies that make kids hate eating veggies!

Another thing I didn't like was that several condiments aren't placed near the dish they are for. For example, horseradish and tartar sauce was hidden next to the salad dressings. They do have some sauces next to their dishes so this is possible, they just don't do it.

Jook (rice congee) and stewed pork belly and eggs were lukewarm due to the heating element so far below the pot. Plus the pork belly wasn't that tender. I make a better one at home.

I also hated how they wrote the dishes' name on the glass with a marker. The orangey-pink color was very hard for me to read, and thus made me hold up the line.  Plus it made it hard to distinguish which name was for what platter. And a bunch of stuff wasn't even labeled. I got this fried thing in the seafood section (not labeled) and it turned out to be deep fried pork belly. What? Yuck!

Now for the good:
What we did enjoy was the kalbi ribs (if you love this, it is worth it). A tad sweet but great with their good and sour kim chi, but totally tender enough to cut with the butter knife. The roasted whole garlic cloves in the grilled veggies platter were fantastic. Also I got seconds of the creamed corn. If the best dish at a buffet is the creamed corn you know you're in trouble.

$8 for a buffet lunch is not bad, but it's the same price at Red Rock and it's so much better!

Oh yeah, no crab legs at lunch.

P.S. To the two middle age white guys next to our table: You guys are so loud and annoying, and it's not cool to talk that loudly and cuss about crap when there are ladies and children around you!

I have been here twice using a travelzoo deal for dinner. It is smaller than the other buffets. 

The customer service is great and you get unlimited wine or beer and they do not skimp on it. The food choices aren't that vast but you have your typical steak, seafood and pasta choices. The place is clean and well kept and in accordance to the feel of the palms. 

It's not a must go but I think this place is a solid buffet because they give you food and alcohol at a reasonable price.
I like the buffet. Simple no frills place. Very good value when you look at other casinos on the strip. Will be back.

The only thing keeping this buffet from getting 5 stars is the small selection of desserts.  It's always been like that, and I don't know why when they have a vast selection of everything else.  This is our fourth or fifth time eating here and it is still delicious.  People giving it low marks must have poor taste buds.

I got the 2 people for $35 deal on TravelZoo that was good for dinner. I went on a Saturday, which is when they have the seafood dinner. (It's also available Friday!) My group of 9 actually sat at two separate tables. They wanted to charge us 18% gratuity for sitting together. We decided to sit apart since we were mostly going to be getting up often to get food anyways.

There was a line to get the crab legs so I didn't bother with that. However, I did get the prime rib, which was cooked medium rare. The shrimp in the shrimp fajitas were super tiny. There is also a condiment bar with different toppings for your fajitas nearby, along with tortillas. I tried to sample a little bit of everything. Nothing really stood out to me. It was just mediocre and some of the items were bland. The pasta that was out looked like it was sitting there for a while. I got a small key lime pie tart for dessert. It was okay. There is unlimited beer and wine here so I got Miller Lite, which was the only beer they had that was unlimited. 

Overall, I was very underwhelmed with the food. I'm glad that I didn't actually pay full price for dinner. They did provide a good variety of selections and I'd recommend going if you had a discount and really enjoy crab legs. Otherwise, I would recommend going to another buffet because there are plenty options that are preferable over Bistro Buffet.

Hey i was happy with this buffet. The selection was actually unique and not what you'd find everywhere else. They include beer with the buffet which makes it all the better. Food quality was pretty awesome and id conclude its well worth what youre paying.

Did i mention the beer??.....*burp*
Just called the Palms. The buffet is closed due to remodeling. It will open around the first of the year.

So many bad reviews, I'm surprised! 

Came here around 8:15 with my parents as we just drove into Vegas shortly before that. We were feeling lazy to go look for something to eat, and decided to head downstairs to our hotel where we stumbled upon this buffet. I'll be honest, at first my expectations were pretty low. There are so many buffets in Vegas, and a lot of them are mediocre at best. And with the dinner price tag of $15, I was expecting your average-just-ok buffet. 

However, I was pleasantly surprised. Let me pre-face by saying that if you get the right things, this place is good! They're trying to do a global cuisine type of ordeal, so different sections have different foods from all over the world. There were your typical stations such as Italian, Mexican, Chinese, and American.

 I started with a salad and carved turkey. Normally, turkeys at places like this can be dry, but not this one! It was tender and moist. My dad got the carved beef and again, claimed that it was not only delicious, but also cooked well. Huge plus for the carving station! My mom then went to the Mongolian BBQ area where she had some had some fun with that. For dinner, they also have shrimp on top of your regular chicken, pork, and beef. A few short minutes later, and bam! Out came our piping hot BBQ. We didn't end up getting noodles, but still delicious. 

I can see a few of the things here being super meh such as the Mexican, soups, sushi, and some of the Chinese and Italian. I also noticed someone saying that there were no heating lamps for the food, but when we went there definitely were! All in all, for $15, this buffet is really worth the price if you play your cards right!

We were all in Vegas and wanted to catch some dinner, at the suggestion of their family friend we came to the Bistro Buffet.  The waitress and hostess' were very friendly.   I would say that if you are already at the Palms, then you might as well eat at the buffet.

However, this was my experience:
*  People / customers using bare fingers picking through salad toppings (No employees around)

*  People / customers not using the utensils but their hands to sort through food on the line
*  Sushi very dried and some pieces tasting very sour (As in been out way to long)
*  Various other dishes really dried out (i.e. sauce, etc.)

Only reason I ate here coz I was staying @ palms. I tried both their lunch and dinner buffet and both time I was disappointed. There is not a big selection, food doesn't look appetizing, most food is used from the day before, all food is bland and the desert area is a joke. For some weird reason, food looked same for 4 straight days......hmmm. For deserts, they have bread pudding, which was kind of tasty, some day old pana cotta, some kind of pudding, hometown buffet style old ice cream machine and week old and dry nasty cupcakes. My two stars goes for service and bread pudding. Service is great but bad food.
The service staff is great but the food is not fresh or doesn't seem of good ingredients. We don't recommend this buffet. The price is around. $20 for brunch and NOT worth it. Stale, boring and junk

Stayed at Palms and got comp'd Breakfast vouchers for their Breakfast Buffet. 

Everything was pretty dissapointing. Scrambled eggs tasted like fake eggs out of a bag. You can tell when you cut into it and see bubbles thru the egg. Sausages were big but tasteless. Pancakes were mini disks chewy and dry. 

Omelette was made to order but lacked any flavors or excitement.

OJ tasted like Tang. 

Good thing it was free with our stay. I wouldn't pay to eat here.

I dont care who gets awarded what!! This is the BEST BUFFET in Las Vegas. The only Vegas buffet that has HOT crab legs. Every time I'm in LV I eat here. Sometimes I eat so much I have to waddle back to my room :)

I only came here because I booked my stay at Palms via Groupon which gave me a $25 spending allotment.  Might as well use it on the $10 buffet.  It's small, average.  Nothing too write home about.  Very limited choices but still a cheap buy.  The decor is beautiful.  Staff are friendly.  Clean floors, organized.  Some items on buffet are labeled, others are not. Coffee is tasty, but they do not offer raw sugar.   They have a delish Asian section which is where I ate the most from.

Went here for lunch and the food was bland in the Chinese cuisine and in the seafood area the catfish was okay and the hush puppies and fried okra were okay, cuts of meat from the butcher area was dry, dessert selection was pitiful with some tiny chocolate mouse in chocolate shell and other variety of red velvet parfait and a couple other choices but nothing is labeled so I don't know what it was and the salad bar area had no labeling on items so it was a guessing game on certain items. The server was missing I guess during shift change so I waited for about 18 minutes before someone actually walked around to flag down and during the whole stay it was a mission to get someone for a drink. To be fair we did get 2 different refills but during the duration of the visit to get the initial drink was a wait as well as during shift change. This place went from disappointing to worse since last visit.

I'm still using up my Palms coupons!! Hunnie Bunnie and I came for LUNCH. Decent buffet I guess. Nothing really stood out but I didn't see anything bad about the buffet either. Just another buffet in Vegas to me personally, a dime a dozen!

We returned to this buffet about 4 months since my last visit.  We had a TravelZoo voucher for a $34.99 for two people with unlimited beer and wine.  I am going to maintain my solid 4 star rating this visit.  

We showed up at about 5pm for an early dinner, and were seated in a comfortable booth near the buffet line.  The decor was nice and the server this time was excellent. She constantly was coming by to check on us, and continue to refill our white wine!  

Everything else was just as good as the prior review.

Wow ! Best bang for your buck at $24 on a friday night all you can eat seafood and beer or wine, you cant beat it. Great deserts, the staff is friendly. We'll be back on friday nights, have never eaten here any other day might have to try it even though they had some negative reviews.

Pretty good with the 2 for one coupon, the crab legs are good but the butter didn't taste like butter this time.. I'll have to tell them about it. Not much on the dessert station and the butter is not next to the rolls which they should be, grape leaves are good here.

I'm generally not a buffet person but for the price value that you get from ordering a single item at one of the restaurants at the Palms versus the selection at the buffet, I found the buffet to be worth it.  I came once for breakfast as well as lunch.  For breakfast, I was happy with my made to order omelette including ham, spinach and tomatoes.  I had a bowl of oatmeal and grabbed an orange and apple to go.  The pre-cut fruit that they offer was not freshly cut but more from out of the can.

For lunch, I narrowed in on the taco station and made myself two soft shell pork tacos with salsa, guacamole and freshly squeezed lime.  The dessert options were nothing to write home about as they are little finger desserts that are two sweet and taste artificial.  

This is definitely not a fancy buffet but if you're looking for a wider variety of food for the same price as an entree at one of the other restaurants at the Palms, you definitely get more bang for the buck and $2 off if you sign up for the free Palms reward card.

Don't waste your money! Not only is the selection extremely limited, but the quality is appalling! And I'm not at all picky! Crusty bagels and muffins, terrible bacon and sausage (I make way better at home). I don't know why they even bother having a buffet if it isn't done right. This is an absolute embarrassment. Frankly, you would be better off eating from the food court. I've been to way better buffets downtown. Don't go unless it's free; trust me.

Rest in Peace, THE BISTRO BUFFET 

FYI - As of October 15, 2016 the palms bistro buffet no longer carries any seafood whatsoever. 

They are now managed by the Station Casinos 100% and they have yet to determine if they will add in a seafood night. 

The old price for a dinner buffet was $17.99 dinner and $24.95 seafood dinner. 

It is now a straight $14.99 every night.

We all loved our food and it's a bargain considering what just one plate of food costs at other nice restaurants.  The pork belly was my favorite.  We came back for thirds on dessert as they were well made and delicious .  We got wine and beer with our meal and they offered free refills. Good value for what they charged

One word: DISGUSTING. I only gave it one star because it served food which is their purpose. But the food was horrible. The ambiance is comparable to my middle school cafeteria. There was food on the floors. All the handles of the serving spoons were sticky and dirty. The service was terrible. The "unlimited wine & beer" sounds like a good deal but its Miller Lite and some horrible wine, which you're lucky if you even get enough service for a 2nd glass, that is if you want anymore at all. 
The crab legs were GROSS. They smelled way too fishy and you had to crack them open yourself with some cheap plastic tool, unlike most other buffets that serve them already split in half. 
It was just terrible. And after you eat there you will spend the next couple days in & out of the bathroom.
My suggestion: DONT EAT HERE!

We go to the Palms a lot, so this isn't a review of any ONE time I've been here. It's a solid buffet that's suffered the slump as the casino has aged - particularly in the desserts which used to be above average and feature weird items like mango cream tarts and now just seems to have the usual buffet bullshit.

For a modern-built buffet, this line is very small too. 

The bonuses: it is cheap and has all you can eat crab. There is a Mediterranean section, though I think the quality of the Med section is terrible. There's a serve-your-own-damn-self coffee machine which makes a solid mocha. The prime rib is usually pretty great here though - they don't skimp on the seasoning for the crust which is important. 

Weird feature: unless you opt for the coffee machine you have to give them your drink order when you pay. 

Other weird feature: famous people at the buffet. Last time we saw a basketball player and someone who was obviously a hooker. A couple of times before that we saw a moderately famous rapper from the 1980s who hasn't been on a reality show and we had to explain to my dad who he was. Famous people and a lot of sex workers starting their days.

Great prices for buffet in vegas. Food quality is excellent and they have a good amount of food options to choose from. They have a little of every different ethnic food there is. Dessert there is THE BEST. Especially the cheesecake. The cheesecake and chocolate cake is nothing ive ever eaten before. I HAD to cheat a little this weekend because of it. 

Waiter was very consistent about refilling our drinks and comes by every so often to ask us how things were going. 

Plenty of seating at this place and i had a comfortable time eating here. Definitely recommending this place to my friends!

Still one of the best values in Vegas for a buffet. Highly recommend Sunday champagne brunch & evenings when crab legs & other delicious fare are offered. Crab legs not offered every night so check ahead. Can't beat it for staff friendliness & experience.
Great breakfast spread. Ate there every day for breakfast and there was something new every time. Very friendly staff as well.

I've eaten here, at the Bistro Buffet, once.  I was taken here because my friend, a local, knows where the food deals are, both on and off the beaten path in Sin City.

Well, I'm glad that someone else paid.  The Palms seems like a nice casino tower.  The casino floor area isn't too shabby, either, and the buffet area, right next to it, is bright and welcoming.  It must have been welcoming because there was one helluva line on this particular day and at this time slot for the lunch buffet.

I know I've got some loons who probably follow my reviews to scour for off kilter content.  Well, let's go there right away.  For some reason, the Bistro Buffet seems to pull in a larger than average Asian clientele, and it seemed that a chunk of them were locals.  So far, that's o.k.  Take note that, for whatever reason, some universities pull in disproportionate numbers of (graduate) students from certain countries.  At a major Big 10 (yes 10, not 12) school, I ran into noticeable numbers of Greeks and Austrians.  I think that it's partly a concerted marketing effort and partly a word of mouth thing.  The same could be true of this hotel and the Bistro Buffet.

That said, the Asian food offerings represented a larger than average portion of their buffet line.  Why was this an issue for me?  I don't do sushi and I don't even like looking at it.  They did have some of the basic Chinese staples I like, such as lo mein and items along the lines of beef broccoli, so I helped myself to those.  That was after stocking up the plate with traditional American food and other ethnic cuisines I tend to gravitate toward.  I believe there was some Mexican food, but not much of it.

The food I put onto my plate(s) was good, but far from memorable.  However, it was better than the lunch buffet I once had at the Monte Carlo, which surprisingly was just on par with cafeteria food.  I gave that one 2 stars.  The desserts here, however, were safe and fairly good.  The buffet was very crowded, so whatever service was conducted by a server (coffee, drinks, etc.) was a little slow but still effective.

I don't care what a deal it was and that someone took me here.  If in Las Vegas again, this buffet has been crossed off the list.  There are too many others to try.  I might have given the Bistro Buffet 2 stars but I'm going to go with 3 stars because of their deals, specials, and pricing.

We ate here for convenience and the food was just ok. The price was good for lunch but mediocre food. Out of all the hot food, I liked maybe two dishes. Some things were overcooked from sitting out too long. The dessert section looks really pretty but most of the items were too sweet or just gross. Forget the ice cream. I don't know what it's made of but it was inedible.

Worst food I have ever eaten. We were given a comp after playing the tables last night. They offered seafood buffet for two. Crab legs are small and not worth the effort. Small shrimp, overcooked salmon. Said seemed ok except the califlour was old and I had to Todd it away. Sugar free chocoLate pie was horrible ur had a horrible taste and aftertaste. The sugar free blueberry pie was mediocre at best. Luckily this was s comp. We would have asked for our money back! Not worth $26 pp

Great selection. A lot of different flavor a represented. Had a really good Mongolian BBQ station. Always like it when I can do self-serve ice cream for dessert. Really good and great buffet value. Others start at $25. This was definitely worth the $$$
The food is decent for its price. The wait staff is very friendly. Its the best place to get breakfast at the palms.

No comments!.... no judgements, no arguments !... I learned long time ago. 
I came here for breakfast and it was long line, ended up had a lunch..we were so hungry and lazy to move somewhere at this point, even line was super long . 
I had to reminded my self couple of times how much I paid for this meal. ($8.99 lunch /$6.99 breakfast )Tried to find something, anything different menu than other typical buffets in Las Vegas.
I came in with open minded, critics and rating is not by my standards nor my preference. Try to rating by value meals and how much I paid for meal and quality.
Anyway... food was cold and not enough heat to keep it warm, fresh and hot food available for Mongolian station. Staffs are friendly and nice, one time experience is good for me to scratch off  from my bucket list (buffets in Las Vegas).

Mediocre food... not enough normal items for normal people.  A bunch of weird, nasty stuff.  
The bad part is:
they throttle everyone in...  there were 12 people in line, it took nearly an hour to get in and 1/3 of the tables weren't being used.   The wait in line was longer after we paid than before.  That is insane.  This is unprofessional and unacceptable.  Overpriced.
It definitely isn't worth $15.99 for dinner... it needs to be about $7.99.  That would be fair.
Waste of money, makes me embarrassed for Las Vegas.  Very overpriced, poor low quality choices, the crab looks like it was frozen.  It's junk.

I got the Groupon deal which is 42 bucks for a buffet and drink package for two There is also a similar deal on travel zoo. So 21 bucks a person when it is normally 26.99 sounds like a good deal. Nope. Its not such a good deal when everything we had was bland. 

Me and the wifey went for dinner on a wednesday night. There was no line so we thought that was a good sign. It should of been a warning. Nevertheless we were hungry and anything was good at the moment.

When we handed the cashier our voucher, the first thing she said was that there were no crab legs today. Crab legs are only served on tuesdays along with seafood Fridays and Saturdays. Huh? Who the heck serves crab on a particular weekday? Weird. Also we had to pay 2 bucks per person for tax. Again, huh? I have used a Groupon voucher before at other restaurants and don't remember ever having to pay sales tax because it is usually already included in the voucher price.

As usual, any time we do up a buffet, we grab a plate and do a little scoping around. Some things looked ok. I came back with a couple slices of ummm well done rare prime rib? Let me explain. The outer part of the meat was so well done that it was actually crispy. The inner part was blood red. I think what happened was that they cooked it at a really high temperature so it looked like it was done from the outside. I don't think they even bothered to use a meat thermometer. If you refer to my pic, my description is 100 percent accurate. Im a carnivore so what they did to that poor peace of meat was pure travesty. Only bright spot was the outer crispy part was mainly seasoned fat which was surprisingly good because raw meat does not have any flavor. And no, I did not try to eat the super red bloody middle part. Well, maybe a little bit of outer part next to it that was medium rare. Still no flavor. 

Wow. I cant believe I just wasted a whole paragraph on improperly cooked prime rib. In other news, we also tried some of the Chinese items like Kung Pao Chicken and Chinese Spare Ribs. They all tasted the same. Dry and rubbery. There were pork spare ribs which looked like it gave me hope but it turned out like the rest only this time they tried to smother it in barbeque sauce. imagine barbeque flavored chewing gum. They had some bacon mac n cheese in a separate little bowl which I thought was kind of cute. Only problem was that the so called bacon part of it was just a couple sprinkles of imitation bacon bits. The cheese sauce itself was watery when you dipped your spoon towards the bottom. The elbow macaroni was surprisingly cooked all the way through.

For those that aren't familiar with the Mongolian style of cooking you basically get vegetables and seasoning together in a bowl. Then you give it to the cook and tell them what type of meat you want cooked with it on a round table type of grill. I put garlic and some chili seasoning on there but still could not get any flavor out of it after the first bite.

Dessert? Maybe it should be called deserted because it looks like the employees just threw some cream and sugar together and put it on display. To play it safe, we got the crme brulee. Its basically flan that has the top glazed with a torch. Unfortunately the top part of it was the only part that was cooked. As soon as we stuck our spoons into it, it was very watery and didn't have any kind of consistency all through out.

The one bright spot from our experience was that our server Rosa was excellent. She consistently filled our sodas and took our plates of mostly uneaten food away. I was thinking she was going to say something about our wasted food but I think by now she is used to seeing people not even try to finish their plates. We gave her a 10 dollar tip because not only did she give us good service, we felt bad for her for having to deal with cleaning up all this bad food on a nightly basis.

In the end, the only things worth mentioning that didn't disappoint were the crispy seasoned fat renderings from the prime rib and our diet cokes which I was surprised was not flat at all the way things were going. The only thing that I can think of that would be worth the price we paid would be that if you were an alcoholic then the all you can drink wine and beer would be right down your alley. I don't drink so im not really sure if getting wasted at a buffet is something special. Bottom line is I DONT RECOMMEND EATING HERE EVEN IF IT WAS FREE! Shame on the Palms for letting a piece of dump like this exist in such a nice casino hotel. Memo to whoever from the Palms that might respond to this. Go ahead. I would like to know your explanation as to why the food here is so horrible. Oh, and don't bother offering me a comped meal. I don't think I can eat there any more because me and the misses are now traumatized and might need therapy. If we do, maybe you guys can foot the bill. That's the least you can do.

Yelp 2015 Review #31
529 overall

Ok buffet!
I'm not gonna lie, you almost lost me at that 30 minute wait and open seating for about 50 people. I felt myself getting hot! with anger. But the good news is, about ten people left the line! Which now puts me third to next! Score..

So the price for a buffet breakfast was about $7 and lunch is about $10 perfect Pricing!  Seems like the cheapest buffet in town! 

Same setting set up as most buffets, same process of the line. Great selection of breakfast items, all your basics were covered. Bacon (check) omelet station (check) waffles and French toast (check) donuts, yup and grits! My favorite (check) 
I was able to see and enjoy the lunch buffet as well just due to the time I got inside was a little in between time, I noticed great dessert selections, a cutting board of ham, I seen soul food like greens, yams, catfish, Mac and cheese, hush puppies, all my Asian favs like orange chicken, egg fried rice, pad Thai noodles, pot stickers.. all the basics covered! 
I would come again for the price and bring a magazine next time for the wait! I was not prepared for that

Well. Love buffets, even ones that are more quantity than quality. Not this buffet though...unbelievably disappointed. 

I received 1/2 off, so figured I would try it. Guess what? It was $11 still...and not worth $5 unfortunately. 
Some feedback to the buffet staff. Keep clean utensils on the buffet...EVERY single one was sticky and dirty to the point of being gummed up! Disgusting...cannot get past how filthy it was.  I even brought napkins up to wrap handles...had to leave a couple cause they were stuck. Wow.

The food quality was just ok. Some items were very good, others...should have just not had if they were going to be done so poorly. 

Don't know if I will be back.

I went here for breakfast and dinner. I would have to say I experienced the same meh experience both times. Although they had a variety of food, it did not look fresh. The food looked like it had been sitting out, and was not refreshed. I am not going to eat, nevertheless gorge myself on something that looks unappetizing. I suppose you get what you paid for. If I was staying on the strip, I would not venture out of my way to go to this buffet, and if I stay at the Palms again, I will not return to the Bistro Buffet. If you are a visual eater like myself I would steer clear of this place regardless of the price, but if you are that kind of person who will eat anything then this is a good place to go. 

One thing that I found very irritating about the line to get into the buffet was that they did not make hotel guests priority. They had two lines for non-hotel guests, and hotel guests, but it didn't matter because they just took one group from each line after another.  I think that if you are staying at a hotel, then the hotel guest should be the first priority to getting a seat.

The Bistro Buffet at the Palms has quickly become my favorite Buffet off the Strip. 

The food quality is really good, especially the mini portions served on individual plates like their mac and cheese and creamy polenta dishes (reminds me of the Wicked Spoon). They also have 3 carved meat options with a crunchy outside/tender inside pork belly, turkey and roast beef. The dinner menu has a NY steak that is excellent, super tender and flavorful. The only reason that I wouldn't give this place a 5th star would be that there isn't enough excellent dishes  (like the steak) to be a perfect experience, although everything is above average.

The desserts are pretty good as well with the only complaint being that there's no ice cream, only the standard buffet soft serve fair. I like their waffle cone for the soft serve and their mini eclairs.

The service is good w/ comp. alcohol for lunch and dinner.

I tried this place out during my spring vacation. Came here for dinner, and came back the next day for breakfast. I'm not big on lunch or dinner buffets so the 4 stars and my main review is for the morning buffet. 

Dinner was good, don't get me wrong. Pretty good selections. The only thing is that every night is seafood night. At least during the weekday so the price goes up to $25 per person. That's a little steep for this place. 

Now, breakfast! My wife and i arrived 30 mins before breakfast was over. They had really good selections and the food was fresh and tasty. I really enjoyed it. And for $8.99...that's awesome!  We even got a chance to see the lunch selection. I was full by that time but from what i saw, food selection was good. 

So give this place a try...

Omg no discount for locals or club cards. Food was old and crusty. And for 15 dollars a person for lunch. McDonalds would of been better. Thanks Palms tou always said "locals first"... i will never ever come here again. Just gross!
If you like cold over priced food. This might be the place for you.! Paid for the brunch thought for the price it would be great worst buffet in town. Never again

Food is okay, but catfish burger is not bad at all. Paid $13.99 is below average in nearby Buffet restaurants. If you are not looking for a fancy buffet restaurant, you can try Bistro Buffet at Palms.

Sorry but honestly, this is a pass.

The crab legs are probably the only noteworthy dish here, except they seem to taste saltier and saltier as I go to get more.  Do they intentionally marinate the crab with the saltwater it came with so the customers get tired of eating it? I don't know..

The Asian dishes are terrible, like always in many buffets.  Even the dessert section was pretty sad.  A couple of standard cakes here and there, a ice cream machine.

The western section was pretty alright, they have a modest variety of meat.  Also the pizza was pretty good, thin crust and cooked crispy to my liking.  But it did little to help the experience.

The thing that really blew this place for me was the service.  Yeah, the service.  How you can get bad service from a buffet, you ask? As I was reaching to grab a slice of turkey, the chef snatches the thong from my hand and gives me one that was cleaned up.  I understand they might be busy and just want to cycle out the meat crusted thongs that's been lying around all day, but seriously, at least ask for it..I can hand it over to you just fine, you don't need to snatch it from my hand :[

As for the waitress, my cup remained empty for I don't even know how long.  Waving my hand in the air in desperation does little to help.  And the salty crab legs didn't help either.  I would've choked on my food if I didn't calm it down with some ice cream.  I know it was lunch time and it's a buffet, but I've had better service at much busier venues.

All in all, not really recommending it.

PRO: Some variety, Palms is a relatively nice venue
CON: Food is bad, service is awfully slow and pretty terrible

After a disappointing lunch buffet the day before, we opted to try the buffet at the Palms casino where we were staying. 

Selection was decent for Sunday brunch, which included seafood options and beer or champagne as well. 

We weren't rushed to finish right away when we were dining with the grandparents. Honestly, we must have been there close to 3 hours...

They do not offer discounts for regular players cards (just the higher level card members). 

Overall the wait time wasn't terrible, the dining area is very clean, and the food selection was very decent for Sunday brunch. 

3.5 stars

Yelp 100 challenge - 38 of 100

Consistently delicious. Monday nights is a perfect date night $14.99 seafood buffet dinner and $5 movies! 

Desert is good and for the price you can't beat the cleanliness and quality!

Family gathering decided to meet here for dinner. Was a bit anxious as the Yelp rating was quite low. However, we were pleasantly surprised at the variety and quality of the food. From yummy Oxtail soup to Asian, Italian, American and seafood choices. Everyone in our party of 8 enjoyed the meal, even the youngsters. They also accommodated requests for special preparation for a person with an allergy. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Although small in size compared to other strip buffets, the room is comfortable and pleasant decor. Get a club card and the cost is much lower and well worth the price. This is a hidden gem among the strips buffet offerings, check it out. We will definitely go here again.

My boyfriend loves buffets, I love omelets, so we went over to Bistro Buffet, so he can have his buffet and I can have made-to-order omelet. Since my friend was playing slots-o'-lots that morning, he was able to get it for my boyfriend and I comped. Apparently, if you sign up for their membership card and acquire 350 slot point, you can get a comped buffet if you go to the promotion desk. Otherwise, sign up for the card, and get the buffet discounted (if you're a local, ask for the coupon book, they have 2 for 1 coupons in there). 

As for the buffet, you get what you pay for. However, the made-to-order omelet, crab legs, and made to order Mongolian BBQ is bomb diggity! :) And there was ice cream to finish it off.

EW.  Jail food probably tastes better.  Wanted to barf on my first bite.   

Only edibles things are:
-pickles
-carrot cake
-tiramisu

One of the best buffets in Las Vegas, hands down! The service can be helped though. Waited 10-15 minutes with only 1 couple in front of us and there were SOOO many open tables available, so either they need more bussers or a better hostess. 

The food is absolutely amazing for a buffet! Yes, it is true - went with a group of 4 girls who don't eat that much and we basically tried everything they offered, that is saying a lot coming from us! The carnitas were great, juicy and flavorful! They also have a Mongolian section. 

Would definitely eat there again and again! Highly recommend!
CLOSED!!! Went here last night to find out they're closed! They are renovating to Open up a new buffet restaurant

Yum YUM! I am on a Saturday and had the seafood. OMG I was in heaven. You should also try the Mongolian section. If you are thinking about going, you should purchase the great deal on Groupon.
P.s. The drinks are unlimited but the service can be pretty slow.

A sad little vegas buffet, in my opnion. The only plus was the price which was under $20.  We went for sunday brunch, wouldn't go back, nor would I recommend it to anyone else. Our omelttes were good, the bacon was fine but there just wasn't much there- no shrimp?  What is a las vegas buffet without shrimp?  I ask  you. What?

Second review on the Bistro Buffet and again a very good Vegas buffet at $18.37 per person. The Players club card is the way to go to get that price. I ate here again May 20/ 2014 and the food is very good in my opinion. I travel once a month to vegas for work and always eat here. I'm glad I'm here on Tuesdays when they have snow crab legs on the buffet. Lets Just say they are so sweet with that butter. No problems or attitude getting them warmed up by cooks. Can't wait to eat here next month again.

Let me tell you I am a huge fan of crab legs and like it a certain way.  I know there is a lot of lazy people out there that want to enjoy food with very little effort needed.  So let me just get this off my chest, I HATE WHEN BUFFETS CUT THE LEGS IN HALF.  Not only is the meat cold by the time you get back to the table but they are dried up.  The only way to eat crab legs is keeping them whole and cracking them yourself.  I know what people are thinking......"I hate cold crab legs and that is the only time they are whole".  WRONG.  AT the bistro buffet you get the whole cold crab legs and hand them to the cook.  He then will steam them for about 1 minute and the result.....perfect hot crab legs that I miss so much.  Well done bistro buffet. 

In addition to the crab legs all the other food is amazing and cooked perfect.  The selection is huge and I would highly recommend this buffet before some of the other expensive ones.

On a side note, always be aware of your surroundings for dangerous crab leg crackers.  Its very easy to get shot in the face by some crab meat.  Its happened to me many times.  My girlfriend has gotten the best distance I've ever seen.  She cracked a leg and meat shot sideways over this guys head about 5 feet and he had no idea this happened.  I spit my wine out of my mouth because it was so funny.  SEE it can be so much fun eating food :)

I expected better from The Palms, but maybe I just put The Palms on a pedestal after that one Real World season. *laughs to self*

Selection is pretty good. However the pizzas were kinda dry and bland. My number one beef with this buffet was that damn coffee/cappuccino maker! Now I love the idea that you can make your own latte, mocha, French vanilla, hot chocolate, etc. just by pushing a button and placing your cup beneath the nozzle. However, this machine malfunctioned several times: would only fill up the cup halfway and would spurt coffee at you. I didn't realize it until I sat down: found coffee stains all over my new dress. So fail. 

Wouldn't come back. 

TIP: Sign up for the Club Palms card (gambling casino card) and get $5 off when you pay with cash.

Not really much I can say that would sway you to go or avoid the Bistro Buffet.  If you have never been to Vegas or never been to a buffet, you might be impressed.  Otherwise, it is a casino buffet, 'nuff said.

Best thing is the variety.  We went for lunch and they had quite a selection.  Guess it was the time of year, but there was NO wait at all, we just paid, got seated, gave our drink orders, and started in.  Honestly don't even remember what we paid, but I have to say it was reasonable for the quality and choices offered.  Nice thing about a buffet is trying just a little of a lot of things.  Pretty standard buffet fare, so nothing is jarring my memory saying "oh, don't forget to mention (insert food here) to fellow yelpers.

Ya know being a food lover with allergies it's tough eating at buffets.. I'm allergic to wheat, corn, peanuts,  walnuts,  clams, & sesame seeds. It's usually a problem to find food that's delicious for the price you pay.  I've tried their breakfast buffet & left unsatisfied with our money back. 

8/26/14  at 4:30 pm on a Tuesday.  I was surprised,  staff was in a decent good mood except for the cashier, Ivelina. She wasn't happy, greeted us but she was very short with us. Wasn't personable at all. That's not a way to set the mood of the customer's buffet experience. 

I tried the mixed greens first.  Added black olive, chick peas, mushrooms & very light Italian dressing. I was kind of grossed out by the serving spoons. I had to get the attention of the lady wiping down the counter.  I did let her know they were filthy & she thanked me for letting her know.

Then I made tacos in a lettuce wrap. I saw the iceberg chopped lettuce in the center with tomatoes.  I asked for assistance so I didn't touch the food. I grabbed big iceberg leaves, added black olives from the salad bar.  Went to the taco station where I skipped the refried beans, wasn't impressed the last time it was watery hardly any beans in it.  Added taco meat,  & shredded cheese on top. 

Round 3 I was lost what to try next.  Had a slice of tri tip (over cooked) & ham on my plate. I was looking at the chicken parm dissatisfied with the selection.  I guess Robert could read my displeasure on my face.  I really love chick parm but it's breaded & usually has what flour or corn starch. 

Robert strikes up a conservation with just asking how I was.  I replied "good, but disappointed". He asked why?  I told him the selection is limited for someone with food allergies.  He said I should try the Mongolian cook to order station. I said I wouldn't know where to start I don't normally eat Mongolian.  I'm not adventurous, ha. Creature of habit. 

I grabbed brocoli, peppers & sprouts (I think they look like white roots). David came right over & made the cook to order meal with beef & chicken because I couldn't decide. He asked me why I was disappointed, because Robert mentioned it.  I told him the list of allergies.  He shook his head,  asked me before he put anything on the meat if I could have soy. I said it was fine. He added soy sauce to them & teriyaki. 

Really great service. I can't remember our servers name shoot. She was from El Salvador. She saw me wiping my hands with my own wet towelette.  She set down on the table 4 more because she knew I had complained about how sticky the serving spoons were up there.  She was the sweetest. 

Your staff is so kind.  I wish the cashiers were as delightfully pleasant as the rest of the staff. Still 5 stars just because the price is right & service was excellent.

Food was good. We got a deal on travelzoo.  They all were very nice.  Unlimited beer and wine.  We got about 6 refills.  Our server was on it. Very attentive and cleared our plates quick. The cooks were nice too.  Overall the experience was great and we'd go back.

My sisters and i decided to eat here for brunch. The buffet is neat, not a lot of food like other Vegas buffets but the price is very reasonable.

There were 20 of us but we don't expect to be seated in a long table. Maybe just in the same area.

Once paid, we headed to the gate where we wait to be seated. The hostess asked how many we were so i told her 20 but don't worry about moving seats and tables because we can just sit in the same area without moving anything. She said she will try her best.

Then, this very RUDE and DISRESPECTFUL floor manager (FAITH) comes and said she cannot sit us together since we did not pay the 18% gratuity fot more than 10 people.  I told her that we do not expect to be seated in a long table just around the same area. What she did was sent my brother to an area where there are five vacant tables of four and she sent  me in a totally different area with my kids. I asked the manager if I can sit on the table next to my brother and she flat out said NO!!!  with a very obnoxious voice and very very rude attitude.  She made sure that all six families we are not together. She separated us all over the place even if there are vacant tables in the same area.

This manager named FAITH should not be a manager there at all. She has no people skills. She is very disrespectful, rude, and not a people person. I hope the hotel managers will act on this.

Not impressed. Food is meh... Only here because my girlfriend bought a coupon. Turns out that the Groupon was for the "seafood" night which is only Tuesday Friday and Saturday, today is Wednesday so the Groupon does not offer any savings and we are paying regular price.

They no longer offer discount to players card members and the quality of food has decreased substantially. We have never stayed at the Palms hotel but it has been somewhat of a tradition that regardless of where we were staying on the strip we would make at least one drive over to the Palms for the buffet and some gambling afterwards. I wasn't so much disappointed with the increased cost aspect of it as I was with the apparent degrade in quality. I especially missed the kalbi beef ribs and the sesame wings.. If anyone reading this has any suggestions for other off strip buffets please feel free to share!

Just didn't like their food. French toast doesn't taste as good as it look. Scramble eggs kinda soggy too me. Quality of the food was just poor. It's edible, but not enjoyable. Coming from Palms, I would expect somewhat decent food. And the only fruits available were oranges or apples. Selection was scarce.

Where can you get a 150 plus items for a buffet dinner for $13.99 ? Quality of food and service is great for the price . Prime rib that comes with the buffet was the best and winner of 'em all . I had been to the high priced buffets in LV known for numerous selections that you pay $60 plus like Wicked Spoon, The Buffet @ Wynn, Bacchanal --for the price, nothing beats this place.

I went there last week with a friend for lunch.  The food was ok.  I like to start my meals with a salad, but the salad bar consisted of mayonnaise salads.  I just want the veggies.  They had roasted veggies that were good.  The crab cakes were mostly fillers.  The iced tea was good.  I think that it was fresh-brewed.  The food was not that good for what I would expect at a buffet near the Strip.  The desserts were generic - they had ice cream out of a machine!!  Some of the casinos well off the strip give freshly scooped ice cream for less than you pay here.

as for the service, the first waiter was great.  He brought refills and asked if we needed anything.  He left in the middle of our lunch, after telling us, and the new guy never once came over to see if we needed anything.  In fact, the first waiter told us his name, but I never saw any server with that name near our table! It is a small area.  There isn't a lot of room for crowds. 

I might return, but I would have lower expectations. I am not a big fan of buffets anymore, and would prefer to go somewhere away from the Strip.

I have been standing in line for over 60 minutes. Paid 30 minutes in waiting another 30 after i pay is complerely rude. They are apso letring literally 100 "vip" Members in front of the uncool people never again will i eat here

Blatantly false advertising .

They advertise NY strip steak at the buffet on a large video screen. 

Not wanting to miss super bowl I checked out the Buffett at lunch - they had steak. So I picked this for dinner during super bowl .


It was super bowl Sunday and at 4pm right when the Buffett opened. I asked about gluten free options. They were few  gluten free protein choices other than steak and chicken wings . Most of the staff didn't even know what gluten was, that's howpoorly trained they were.

So I patiently WAITED for the NY STRIP steak to come out.... No steak.  They never intended to serve ANY NY STRIP STEAK AT ALL DURING THE ENTIRE MEAL! BUT THEY STILL ADVERTISE IT! I saw some during lunch and they are tiny pieces about the size of a regular McDonald's hamburger bearing no resemblance to the steak shown on the video ads and in the hotel rooms.

The restaurant doesn't have butter, just the " butter flavor" liquid they use on popcorn. Took them 10 minutes to go to another restaurant to get butter... And they serve corn on the cob! 

No food was "kept to temperature" 140 degrees ( all was cold- no steam)   , cold despite me coming in right when the Buffett started and the food was cold at the core too . Many items like the corn in the cob, chicken wings, ribs were previously frozen .

Indian casinos do a much better job. 

$22.71 to be bait and switched from NY STRIP to chicken wings. It made my super bowl a crappy experience .

I asked the hostess for a refund and she said she would get a manager - the manager said "We NEVER ISSUE REFUNDS" 

I think this restaurant is representative of the Palms Experience you can expect here . I have stayed at South Pointe which is lack luster compared to the rest of the strip , I gotta say South Pointe is a far better experience . We personally know George Maloof ( a friend from Aspen Colorado) who would simply not stand for this.  

I then asked the hotel to credit me and they also refused. Don't expect American customer service here .

Too bad The Palms has become a place for " low rollers " only.

Don't say I didn't warn you about this Buffett .
When I see George on the slopes this winter in Aspen, I'm making him pick up the check.

Save yourself the disappointment and stay away from this place. And don't let the Groupon fool you in thinking you can get this buffet at a good price. Unfortunately that's where my negative review starts. They claim on Groupon that the normal price for two is $90+ and that you're saving about 50% buying a Groupon for $42. When my girlfriend and I went to the buffet to use the Groupon, I was sorely disappointed seeing the normal price at $20.99 per person. So I pretty much spent the same amount when I thought I was getting a good deal.

Second, in its Groupon description it mentioned prime rib and crab legs. But we called ahead assuming that they'd have those premium items on certain nights only. I was right. Prime rib was on Tuesdays while Seafood was on another night. I elected for prime rib. Another huge disappointment was seeing roast beef where the prime rib should be. Not trying to be a food snob, but roast beef is NOT prime rib. 

Its sad cause the actual place looks comparable to the elite Vegas buffets. They even use that new trends that the nice buffets have in plating some of their signature dishes in separate little plates and containers. But as nice as the presentation is, the food is mediocre at best. It took me a lot of walking back and forth for me to pick up my first item cause nothing really appealed to me. 

The only thing that wasn't terrible was the service. We got our drinks and refills when needed. And our empty plates didn't sit on the table long. But I wasn't surprised since the buffet was only 25% occupied. I guess its cause most of Vegas knows to stay away from this buffet. As should you.

Good:
1: Kids under 5 are free.
2: No lines on Saturday @ 5PM.
3: 50% up to $50 from Vegas Advisor accepted.
4: $28 for four people plus $10 tip. Awesome!
5: Great selection of many different foods.
6: Friendly and professional staff.
7: Bottomless beer and wine.

Bad:
1: No bathroom inside buffet.
2: Limited valet parking on premise.

Went here at the end of January on a Friday night and wasn't impressed.  The decor was a pistachio green with brown trim?   I get it, it's the theme of the casino, but doesn't really pop for me when looking for a place to eat.  In this case, we went for the dinner.

Anyways, as buffets go, it somewhat small, as even many Indian casino buffets seem larger.   The food was decent, if uninspiring.  Nothing really stood out taste wise and the look of the buffet itself had a look not unlike a school cafeteria.   The buffet was rather lightly attended, patron wise, which made for a least a more relaxed sitting.

What bothered me was that the help seemed really uninterested in their jobs.   One chef/server actually turned and walked away as  I and another approached the dessert bar, as if he had something better to do.  The guy manning the carvery saw that, stood at the meats for a while then came over, shaking his head.  Whether it was from thinking of his coworker or being bothered by having to cover for him I'm not sure, but it doesn't make for the greatest experience for a diner.

The table waiter did okay, neither distinguishing himself or taking away from the experience.   

So overall, I can't say this was a bad place because it wasn't.  But neither was it something I'd want to go back to.  Not when so many other better ones exist elsewhere.

This buffet deserves a much better score because the food is outstanding. At first we didn't expect much from this place, but the price was affordable. When we got that first plate of food our jaws dropped to our stomachs.

There may not be many options, but what they got is cooked perfectly. I was surprised to see that they had Pad Thai here and it was pretty good. They also had Curry chicken and the chicken was very moist. They had Ribs and Korean Short Ribs which were both tender and had that fall off the bone goodness. I was in heaven.

They have a whole turkey dinner with all the fixins. The turkey and the stuffing were very moist and flavorful. The mashed potatoes were nicely seasoned with herbs. The mac and cheese was amazing!!! Super cheesy and super tasty. I would be happy with just these options, Like a nice home cooked meal.

The only thing they don't have a good selection of is dessert. They have standard pies and ice cream. It's okay though. I was so full from all the deliciousness that I didn't have room for dessert.

Quality over quantity. That's what I always say. The food is exceptional and so is the price. Better than many other buffets that are on the strip.

I liked this buffet. They had a variety of food and the service was not bad, which is important in Vegas. Some places are really hit or miss in that department. But we came in late on a Saturday and they were very helpful and made sure we got everything we wanted before they closed. The food is definitely not Wicked Spoon, but honestly, I have had worse in Vegas.

Well let me start from the SERVICE!!My waitress GLORIA IS VERY RUDE AND BOSSY, my dear you are in the WRONG business, your actitud is very crapy, you should be working at a zoo with animales where you belong,  people pay money to eat and tip!! But you dont deserve it because of your manners very RUDE!!! Now lets talk about the food/ i order new york steak  MEDIUM!! Come out RARE , when i told  my waitress she gave me a nasty look like im her employee or i eating for free!!! The my pancakes was burned!!! If you are the server you know BETTER!!! Check your food before you take it to the tables right??  also i ask her for a hot drink . She replied  !! I dont know if we have??? Ok  she comeback with a coffe so dammmmmm strong!!! I cant even drink it.  Somehow the 24 hours caffe closed for tonight so they decided to open the buffet for a late men. Big mistake!! Im sure this waitress work at the 24 hours caffe too. Please people avoid this waitress if you want to enjoy a meal. To bad for you GLORIA im a server my self and i know your mistakes.

I'd give this buffet 3.5 stars. It has a large selection of Asian food
If you use a players card you get a discount.

When I first ate at this buffet, it was one of the best around. However, the last few times I went, the product has declined significantly. The service is still great, but the food could be a lot better. The food was left out too long and dry and this was never the case when I first came to this buffet. They still have products worth eating, but with the price increasing and the selections decreasing, I would save my money for now. They have a new chef so hopefully the next time I visit the food will be a lot better.

This is a buffet that is limited in options but considers the execution of their limited menu.  A refund pallet is happy here.  Not a lot of pricey and elaborate choices but a good selection for the price. Alcohol is ok included.
This has become the best buffet in town.  Reasonable price and awesome food.
It was an okay buffet. Had a really long line for no reason. The food was decent.

The only good thing about this place was the mangolian grill. Food and service were just okay. Got ripped off on the travelzoo offer. The offer said it was a discounted price so we purchased it. Same offer was at the door. Lame!!! Will never go back and will never recommend this place to anyone. There are better buffets in Vegas.
Recently went to Bistro Buffet for the Sunday champagne brunch. The champagne was flowing but the food needs improvement. The price was right and it was very filling.

Very typical buffet but the shortened version of it.  I mean, this is very small for a Vegas buffet and charges about $22 for dinner.  So that means the options were small as well, but at least it had a carving station of prime rib only.  There was fried rice, but no orange chicken!!!

I wasn't that hungry, so I wasn't too mad that there weren't too many options there.  I only got salmon and prime rib as my protein and potatoes and rice as my starch.  Can't remember anything else there that was too spectacular.  For less than $10 more, go to a bigger buffet if you're hungry.

For the breakfast buffet They have an omelet bar with about 30 ingredient options. You could even get egg whites. 

The hot bar had French toast with an amazing blue berry compote that rivals some of he high end breakfast restaurants I've been too. This isn't the stereotypical Vegas buffet depicted in most movies. 

So if you are in Vegas I would suggest you adventure off the strip to the palms for breakfast.

We have been to this buffet quite a few times.  We decided to come here on a Sunday night and was surprised at how long the line was.  We waited for 20 minutes to get in.  I didn't realize that Sunday night was seafood night.  They had a wide selection of seafood items from gumbo to deep fried fish. Lots of shrimp, mussels and calamari made in many different ways.  They also had New York steak cooked medium. Although I would have preferred it more rare, it was still tasty nonetheless. Their Asian section is always good and this particular night their pancit was very tasty.  They also have a Thai section with different types of green, yellow curries to entice your pallet. Everything was quite good, but because we got there later in the evening, the dessert section was limited and I didn't get my usual plate of watermelon, cantaloupe and honeydew. The only other complaint I had was that their spoons and ladles to scoop the food were pretty sticky.  They need to clean these more often, especially with the volume of traffic they had that evening.

Stations casino recently purchased the Palms Casino and my wife and I decided to try their advertised $6.99 breakfast buffet.  Great price right?  And how can you ruin breakfast right?  Well the new management and kitchen staff did!  You make all the food Luke warm in the serving pans.  Nice selection of food from pancakes, eggs, bacon, carved ham, sausage.  You name it!  But when you sit down to take a bite and everything is just warm...and you tell the head chef...and you get "WE ARE AWARE OF IT!"  And you tell the manager and you get "I WILL TELL THE KITCHEN STAFF". Not the correct response for us to come back!  BYE

This was an exorbitant waste of money.  First of all, it is a very small buffet in its offerings in comparison to all the other one's I've been too, and the food was just, bleh.  The only good thing I could say was that some of the desserts were pretty good.  But overall, save your money and go to a better buffet.
breakfast option that wasn't the overpriced $10.98 with The club Palm card underwhelming hotel breakfast buffet. I tend to be a huge fan of places specializing in breakfast food here.

This buffet was not really that good. Me and my buddy went to eat here prior to hitting the town. We get there and it was pretty empty. Maybe about five more guests were eating here. 

The selection was the smallest I have ever seen in Vegas. They tried to have every international flavor there is but it would only be one or two main courses. 

A buffet would not be a buffet without Prime Rib. The Prime Rib here was ehh. It did not seem like the middle pieces had any sort of flavor. It was juicy but not tasty. 

I would not recommend going to this buffet. You can definitely find a better buffet in Vegas than this.

This review is based on the new Stations management of the Bistro buffet from a local who has eaten here for over 8 years. I so miss the old buffet manager Mary who was a legend in the buffet industry.

I've seen the price drop from $32 bucks to now $12.99 with your stations players card. I was warned to do only breakfast or lunch but after vommiting from the dinner buffet for an hour I learned the hard way. 

Service: Even at 7pm on Friday there was no line no waiting. However,  I didnt get served a drink till 20min later and two rounds of food. It seemed a little busy inside with kids.

Food: The salads looked ok. The menudo like dog food. The soups and desserts looked stale. Nothing special with asian or italian section or sliced meats.
The pizza tasted like rubber. The mac and cheese was actually really good. 

Drinks: I opted out for soda and got weird smelling orange juice. This was exchanged for apple juice which tasted better. I miss the alcohol that was once here.

I've had the station's buffet at Red Rock and Green Valley which is not bad, but this venue was more like Palace Station. If your stomach was built for Caesars Bachannal buffet,Cosmo or Aria then this place might be a problem.

It was sad to see people coming in with coolers passed the buffet since at one point Michael Jackson ate here.
 
Cleaniness: Cashier area was dirty. My table was wet. The buffet stations seemed cleaned. 

Goodbye Palms Casino Bistro Buffet. Hello M buffet and Caesars you have my attention again.

For the price you pay you can't really complain about the quality and lack of selection. We came at lunch their selection was scarce but the Mongolian bbq part was nice and their dessert was actually awesome! Would I come back? Probably not

Not too bad, it's a cheap alternative to eating at the 24-7 or the other fancier restaurants in the Palms hotel.

Cheap, too. $7 for breakfast, $11 for lunch. Didn't do the dinner.

Breakfast had an omelette station (they really overpack them), fruit, ham, bacon, and more.  Pastries, but no pies or ice cream, though. Ends at 10a for entry, I think.

After that, the lunch buffet wasn't bad, pasta, pizza, corned beef, turkey, various American Chinese and other dishes that filled the plate and palate with all-you-can-eat goodness stuffed to the gills. Overall not a bad selection of different foods, including a Middle Eastern roast chicken dish. Different.

If you're a hotel guest or card holder, you get into the "faster" line, and the regular drinks, I was impressed they had three types of sweetened ice tea (I had the green tea w/honey).

Service is a bit slow.  It is smaller than most casino buffets that I am familiar with, but not bad overall. Cheap. Order drinks separately at a different price.

This place has been bad from the very beginning, and it has not improved at all.
    The only reason my wife and I went to breakfast here was we got the 2 fer 1 coupon at the players card swipe.  We figure you can't screw up bacon and eggs can you?  Well, yes you can.  I got a ham and cheese omlett, and it was watery and the cheese wasn't melted.  Yuk. Also, not a great selection.  We went to Red Rock buffet the next morning, and it blows this buffet away.
   Doesn't any of the Palms management or George himself ever eat here just to sample the fare to see if it is up to Palms standards?  Apparently not.

I bought the $30 promotion for two. My experience was pleasant the staff was extremely friendly and they even let my friends hangout eve though they did not eat. Now as far as the the alcohol goes they only had Miller light and one type of red and white wine, but its all you can drink. a family of 3 was celebrating their child's birthday and the staff came out and sang Happy Birthday. 
I hope you enjoy. Lastly the selection of food was decent and tasted good. SHHH sneak some cookies to go and eat them later in your room at night or in the morning (dont tell the staff tho)

This buffet is basically a cafeteria. I like the Thai curries, but the rest is mediocre. Worse, the guys that work here are just jerks. They're very pushy. It's a negative atmosphere. They clearly don't like the customers. It's a good price for a buffet, but the bad atmosphere isn't worth it. If you have to go to the Palms Casino, I suggest the 24/7 Cafe. The 5.99  Burger Basket is very enjoyable.

This place is really not worth the money. We used a groupon, and even with that we did not feel it was worth it. Most of the food is gross. The buffet is really lacking quality choices. The dessert section only had a handful of choices, and none of them were really all the great. I will not come back here. The buffet at Palace Station is way better at a fraction of the cost

I commend them for finally coming around to fixing their menu. It's so much better now compared to the last couple of times I've eaten here.

$13.99 deal for dinner with a Palms card (it's worth grabbing a card since its free.)
Dinner is from 4pm-11pm.

$24.99 or their seafood buffet also.

When I came, they had such good selections. SEAFOOD GALORE! I had their clams, mussels, and their lobster. So glad that they finally offered crab legs on a regular day, but be careful, they run out fast so make sure you keep an eye on it when they bring out the fresh batch because that's when the meaty legs come out!

They offered tri tip, ny steak, and Kalbi ribs along with their usual meat carvings (ham and turkey). They also offered Lebanese dishes that day as well. Oh! Hawaiian pork and cabbage and oxtail soup was offered as well. Hooray! I was so excited.

They have a nice selection of desserts. Usual pies and cakes. They have brownies, cookies, and baklava as well. Best part though was the latte and coffee machine! Sweet.

Only downside was that the food dries up sometimes (like the pad thai. Dont try the pad thai. Not worth taking up stomach space for) and the serving spoons and tongs were SUPER hot that I couldn't hold them. Mainly because they sit under the light for so long. I think the warmers are a little too hot!

But, thanks to their better food selection, I would probably look forward to eating here again the next time around (like maybe when they send a nice 2 for 1 deal).

We ate at the Bistro Buffet (Palms guest can sign up for a membership during their stay and get discounts through out the hotel). The restaurant has a very nice look to it. It is modern in appearance, and has an upscale cafeteria feel about it. But I wasn't too impressed with the food. The food was some what distasteful, while others were okay.

The buffet is the most reasonable in Las Vegas. Youll get a additional discount if you have a Palms card. They have a large variety of food selection to choose from. I came here every time I come to Las Vegas.

I'm not a huge fan of buffet, but for 12.99 for a lunch buffet I was pleasantly surprised. Everything I had was really flavorful. The meat was really flavorful (tri tip & turkey). Only thing I didn't care for was the eclairs (dough was bland & over cooked). Like I said, pleasantly surprised for $12.99.
Its average.  I think I like it better when it was palms casino not stations casino.  They changed menu. Services is good but food is just ok.

We had a great lunch at the Bistro Buffet yesterday. Since the Palms is now a Station Casino, we weren't sure they would accept our Las Vegas Advisor 50% coupon, but they were so nice about it. The staff was super friendly and really accommodating. The food is different from when it was the Palms, but I would say it's better. Though the Palms had some unique dishes, some of them weren't all that tasty or a little weird. The buffet now is more along the lines of a Green Valley Ranch-- much more normal. They had a huge salad bar, and the desserts were yummy. Everything we had was really good. I especially enjoyed the Asian food section. We will definitely be going back again soon.

At the time I went there was a promotion going on. With a Palm's Club Card breakfast was 5.99, Dinner was 7.99 and seafood buffet was 13.99. My girlfriend and I had breakfast here, and dinner here and it was all dandy.

The food wasn't great, but it wasn't horrible either. And for under $15 for breakfast and $20 for dinner, I really have nothing bad to say about this place.

I am a meat eater and had no problem getting my fix during breakfast and dinner.

My only possible complaint, was that the refills didn't come as often as I wanted to but it's okay. I'm willing to overlook that.

4 stars!

I read some of the recent reviews and decide it's worth a visit.  We got huge classes of orange juice, lunch is $19.99 or $12.99 with player's card since it's new years day.  Great food, attentive service, fancy decor, overall I am pleased!

Reviewing hangover breakfast buffet only! Here comes another drunken review!

After all night "partying"... at the 24 hour fitness and burning tons of calories, I was craving some greasy goodness. Seated right away by the hostess. Food is mediocre, mostly standard items: pancakes, ham, bacon, eggs, sausages. Omlet station is great, so I can balance all that bacon with 2 spinach leaves. 

$7.99/person + tax. Not bad, not great.

I went to the Bistro Buffet prior to an evening concert.
The buffet was not crowded early in the evening. 
The service was fine, the food was O.K.
Most people were eating the snow crab legs.

I enjoyed the sushi, and made a french dip sandwich out of the prime rib from the carving station.

I agree with Kevin K, the buffet has a nice open feel with good service, but the food will not overwhelm you.
You will leave feeling comforable, because the price is very reasonable.
If you have a players club rewards card you save $4.00 on dinner.

A good place to eat if you neeed a quick, nice meal.
Good food and extremely friendly staff! Everyone that worked there seemed to genuinely enjoy they're job and were very quick to take care of us. Great hostess too. We will definitely come back!

Holy God Awful. If you like tiny apple pies for $20.99 this is the buffet for you. Nothing and I mean nothing is that good here. Go to the Fiesta, not the greatest buffet but the food is better there and its $9.99.  

I spent $40.00 on something masquerading as food. Everything that should be hot was almost lukewarm. 

Mr. Man said the ribs were nasty. But he said that the NY steak was good even though it had been sitting out. Kraft macaroni and cheese was doctored up with bacon. 

Seriously, who was cooking tonight? Our clue that it's not good here should have been, no line, no patrons, six employees. 
I love bread...I can eat bread all day and the bread here (garlic breadstick and a wheat dinner roll) is bad. 


I gave this buffet one star for the delicious mini Apple pie and delicious soda (because that is the only thing that you can't really screw up) and another star for our server. We liked the server.

Ok so I eat here frequently due to My boss always wanting to go eat there and I remember what it was like when it first opened up and it was really good back then, but last night just summed up where this buffet is going... to the dumps. 

The Crab had a lot of "black" rotten looking parts and was not cooked well, the sushi is meh, the rest of the food was very "dry" and most looked as if it has just been sitting there a long time. 

I remember when it used have a great Middle Eastern selection, which is now some dried up meat slices and pita bread and a few other things. I really cannot believe there letting it get this bad.

I have to say the best thing for me last night was the vanilla ice cream from the machine.

It is not even that cheap of a buffet.

The servers are nice and generally fast so that saved this review from a one star.

We did talk to the waitress and she said many customers are complaining but that the manager lady says the foods good and does not want to hear it.

Sadly, this gets my first two star rating.

I really liked the food at this buffet! A variety of foods, Mexican, Asian, seafood, American. Very tasty crab legs, oysters, curry. The deserts were not spectacular, just ok. They offer all you can drink wine and beer- not good, bud light and the red wine was the worst I have tasted:( The place itself is very casual, a little sloppy. Great food though!

I ate here last night, and the food was disgusting. It was super expensive And it tasted worse than home town buffet. The macaroni and cheese there was the worst one I've ever tried in my life. It was watered down, hard Mac and cheese. Never again will I eat there.

2/$42 
I wont come back here anymore. Food wasn't good at all! Disappointed! Dont waste your time n money!

Before eating here, get a Club Palms card and enjoy the discount+raking up points at the slot machines. 
I am not really sure where the negative comments are coming from. By buffet standards, the food is actually pretty dang good. Variety of dishes to choose from with variety of fresh fruit, drinks, etc. I thought their omelets were great and their breakfast potatoes were exactly how I like them. 
The only thing I didn't like was the coffee. You can tell they either use the instant mix or brew some cheap acidic stuff.
4 stars for the food selection and the service. 1 star off for the coffee.

why so many bad reviews? maybe it's not the wynn buffet but shieeeet it's like half the price! i've nearly been to them all and to me, they're all basically the same. maybe the food isn't as glamorous as the wicked spoon, but it's definitely a thousand times better than the buffet at the orleans for example. but they have ACTUAL crab legs that you have to break yourself to get that glorious piece of meat out. dip that shit in butter and get ready to break out with acne all over the place the next day. i also find serious humor in watching others try so hard to break the shells only to get crab fragments because they don't know how to properly crack. 

make sure to sign up for a player's card before going!
One of the best buffet in Vegas. Wide variety and everything taste delicious! Too bad it's off the strip and not a lot get to enjoy this great place!

After emerging extra crispy from Ditch Fridays we approached the concierge and asked what restaurants they had.  They told us of the Bistro Buffet and quoted a way lower price than what they charged or we may not have gone there.  They had a Seafood/International Buffet which was on point!  In our half drunken, half starving spell we descended on that buffet like zombies.   Crab Legs, Snow Crab Legs, Shrimp, Sushi, Carving stations with pork and steak. You name it, we were stuffing our faces with it!  The variety wasn't crazy, but there was a wide enough selection to keep us all happy.
